name: File Upload to Backend
description: A generic file uploader. (Converted from Langflow Store for AxieStudio compatibility)

path.name: path
path.info: Supported file types: txt, md, mdx, csv, json, yaml, yml, xml, html, htm, pdf, docx, py, sh, sql, js, ts, tsx

code.value:
from pathlib import Path
import shutil
from axiestudio.base.data.utils import TEXT_FILE_TYPES, parse_text_file_to_data
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import BoolInput, FileInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data


class FileComponent(Component):
    display_name = "File"
    description = "A generic file uploader."
    icon = "file-text"
    name = "File"

    inputs = [
        FileInput(
            name="path",
            display_name="Input Path",
            file_types=TEXT_FILE_TYPES,
            info=f"Supported file types: {', '.join(TEXT_FILE_TYPES)}",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="opath",
            display_name="Output Path",
            info="Path to the directory to load files into.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="silent_errors",
            display_name="Silent Errors",
            advanced=True,
            info="If true, errors will not raise an exception.",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Data", name="data", method="load_file"),
    ]

    def load_file(self) -> Data:
        if not self.path:
            raise ValueError("Please, upload a file to use this component.")
        resolved_path = self.resolve_path(self.path)
        silent_errors = self.silent_errors

        extension = Path(resolved_path).suffix[1:].lower()

        if extension == "doc":
            raise ValueError("doc files are not supported. Please save as .docx")
        if extension not in TEXT_FILE_TYPES:
            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported file type: {extension}")

        # Save the uploaded file to a local directory before processing
        local_save_directory = self.opath
        Path(local_save_directory).mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)  # Create directory if it doesn't exist
        local_file_path = Path(local_save_directory) / Path(resolved_path).name

        # Copy the file to the local directory
        shutil.copy(resolved_path, local_file_path)

        # Parse the file data
        data = parse_text_file_to_data(local_file_path, silent_errors)

        self.status = data if data else "No data"
        return data or Data()

from pathlib import Path
import shutil
from axiestudio.base.data.utils import TEXT_FILE_TYPES, parse_text_file_to_data
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import BoolInput, FileInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data


class FileComponent(Component):
    display_name = "File"
    description = "A generic file uploader."
    icon = "file-text"
    name = "File"

    inputs = [
        FileInput(
            name="path",
            display_name="Input Path",
            file_types=TEXT_FILE_TYPES,
            info=f"Supported file types: {', '.join(TEXT_FILE_TYPES)}",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="opath",
            display_name="Output Path",
            info="Path to the directory to load files into.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="silent_errors",
            display_name="Silent Errors",
            advanced=True,
            info="If true, errors will not raise an exception.",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Data", name="data", method="load_file"),
    ]

    def load_file(self) -> Data:
        if not self.path:
            raise ValueError("Please, upload a file to use this component.")
        resolved_path = self.resolve_path(self.path)
        silent_errors = self.silent_errors

        extension = Path(resolved_path).suffix[1:].lower()

        if extension == "doc":
            raise ValueError("doc files are not supported. Please save as .docx")
        if extension not in TEXT_FILE_TYPES:
            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported file type: {extension}")

        # Save the uploaded file to a local directory before processing
        local_save_directory = self.opath
        Path(local_save_directory).mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)  # Create directory if it doesn't exist
        local_file_path = Path(local_save_directory) / Path(resolved_path).name

        # Copy the file to the local directory
        shutil.copy(resolved_path, local_file_path)

        # Parse the file data
        data = parse_text_file_to_data(local_file_path, silent_errors)

        self.status = data if data else "No data"
        return data or Data()
